parameter_description: The modulation wheel is typically used to control the amount of modulation in a patch
notes: The mod wheel can be freely assigned as both modulation source and modulation controller via the assignable controllers section and the mod map

parameter_description: Clickless muting of Muse's MAIN OUT signal
Increasing the glide control will increase the amount of time it takes to move from one note to the next, creating a portamento effect
Volume control for the currently active timbre (A/B) before it reaches the voice summing busses
Spreads allocated voices apart giving a wider feel to the stereo image
Bipolar control for manual adjustment of the pan-position of the currently active timbre (A/B) in the stereo field
Controls the frequency of LFO 1
notes: The range of this knob defaults to 0.01 Hz–40.00 Hz but has a maximum range of 0.00 Hz – 1.00 kHz (configurable in MORE menu)

parameter_description: Selects the wave shape of LFO 1
usage: 0-24: Triangle; 25-49: Saw; 50-74: Square; 75-99: Random; 100-127: User Wave

parameter_description: Controls the frequency of LFO 2
notes: The range of this knob defaults to 0.01 Hz–40.00 Hz but has a maximum range of 0.00 Hz – 1.00 kHz (configurable in MORE menu)

parameter_description: Selects the wave shape of LFO 2
usage: 0-24: Triangle; 25-49: Saw; 50-74: Square; 75-99: Random; 100-127: User Wave

parameter_description: Control the frequency of the PITCH LFO
notes: The range of this knob defaults to 0.01 Hz–40.00 Hz but has a maximum range of 0.00 Hz – 1.00 kHz (configurable in MORE menu)

parameter_description: Bipolar control adjusting the angle of the PITCH LFO's waveform
notes: At noon the waveform is a symmetrical triangle wave. Adjusting shape shifts the triangle's rise and fall times, becoming a sawtooth wave when fully counterclockwise and a ramp wave when fully clockwise

parameter_description: Bipolar control over the depth of the PITCH LFO's modulation of its hardwired destinations
notes: When set to noon the amount knob will yield no modulation. Adjusting the knob clockwise from noon will result in positive modulation of the destination while adjusting the knob counterclockwise from noon will result in inverted modulation of the destination

parameter_description: Routes the PITCH LFO to modulate OSCILLATOR 1 when engaged
Routes the PITCH LFO to modulate OSCILLATOR 2 when engaged
Routes the PITCH LFO to modulate the MODULATION OSCILLATOR when engaged
Routes the PITCH LFO to modulate the DETUNE knob in the VOICE CONTROL section when engaged
Controls the frequency of the modulation oscillator
Sets the modulation oscillator to operate at audio-rate frequencies
Enables keyboard control of the frequency of the modulation oscillator
Selects the waveform of the modulation oscillator
Resets the LFO to its starting point in its wave cycle every time a key is pressed
Enabled unipolar mode for the modulation oscillator
Determines the depth at which frequency modulation of the oscillator section occurs based on the OSC 1 and OSC 2 routing buttons
Enables frequency modulation of OSC 1 via the modulation oscillator
Enables frequency modulation of OSC 2 via the modulation oscillator
Determines the depth at which pulse width modulation of the oscillator section occurs based on the OSC 1 and OSC 2 routing buttons
Enables modulation of the duty cycle of the OSC 1 pulse/square waveshape via the modulation oscillator
Enables modulation of the duty cycle of the OSC 2 pulse/square waveshape via the modulation oscillator
Determines the depth at which cutoff frequency modulation of the filter section occurs based on the FILTER 1 and FILTER 2 routing buttons
Enables cutoff frequency modulation of FILTER 1 via the modulation oscillator
Enables cutoff frequency modulation of FILTER 2 via the modulation oscillator
Determines the depth at which the MODULATION OSCILLATOR will modulate the amplitude of the VCA, providing a tremolo effect
Enables pan-position modulation of a voice in the stereo field by inverting the phase of the modulation oscillator sent to the right VCA
Selects the octave for OSC 1
notes: The OCTAVE options are 16', 8', 4' and 2' - a standard based around classic pipe organ stop footage settings.

parameter_description: Detunes OSC 1 from the pitch associated with a keyboard note
notes: The FREQUENCY knob is a bipolar control, and when set to noon will be in tune with the keyboard note (if a C is pressed, a C will sound based on the OCTAVE setting). Turning the knob clockwise will increase the pitch of the oscillator up to a perfect fifth (+7 semitones) and turning the knob counter-clockwise will decrease the pitch of the oscillator down to a perfect fifth below the note (-7 semitones)

parameter_description: Selects the octave for OSC 2
notes: The OCTAVE options are 16', 8', 4' and 2' - a standard based around classic pipe organ stop footage settings.

parameter_description: Detunes OSC 2 from the pitch associated with a keyboard note
notes: The FREQUENCY knob is a bipolar control, and when set to noon will be in tune with the keyboard note (if a C is pressed, a C will sound based on the OCTAVE setting). Turning the knob clockwise will increase the pitch of the oscillator up to a perfect fifth (+7 semitones) and turning the knob counter-clockwise will decrease the pitch of the oscillator down to a perfect fifth below the note (-7 semitones)
